Description:
Detects the creation of a scheduled task using the "-XML" flag with a file without the '.xml' extension. This behavior could be indicative of potential defense evasion attempt during persistence

Author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel, Elastic (idea)
Sigma Repository: [GitHub](https://github.com/SigmaHQ/sigma)
Name: Suspicious Scheduled Task Creation via Masqueraded XML File
Query: sourcetype='windows-sysmon' eql select * from _source_ where (((command like '%/create%' or command like '%-create%') and (command like '%/xml%' or command like '%-xml%') and (process_path like '%\schtasks.exe' and original_file_name = 'schtasks.exe')) and  not ((parent_process_path like '%\rundll32.exe' and (parent_command_line like '%:\windows\installer\msi%' and parent_command_line like '%.tmp,zzzzinvokemanagedcustomactionoutofproc%')) or command like '%.xml%' or (integrity_level = 'system' or integrity_level = 's-1-16-16384')) and  not (parent_process_path like '%:\programdata\oem\upgradetool\carecenter_*\bunzip\setup_msi.exe' or parent_process_path like '%:\program files\axis communications\axis camera station\setupactions.exe' or parent_process_path like '%:\program files\axis communications\axis device manager\admsetupactions.exe' or parent_process_path like '%:\program files (x86)\zemana\antimalware\antimalware.exe' or parent_process_path like '%:\program files\dell\supportassist\pcdrcui.exe'))
